message_1: Suppose you are designing an experiment with 3 factors, each of which has 3 levels. How many runs would be required using an orthogonal array to ensure that all possible factor combinations are tested?
message_2: To test all possible factor combinations in an experiment with 3 factors, each with 3 levels, you would need an orthogonal array with 3^3 = 27 runs. This is because there are 3 levels for each of the 3 factors, and you need to test each combination of levels for all factors.
